solution.text:
Percentage of apples = \( \frac{Number \,of \,apples}{ Total\, number\, of \,apples\, and\, oranges} \times 100\).
Percentage of apples = \( \frac{Ratio\, of\, apples}{ratio\, of\,apples + ratio\, of\, oranges} \times 100 \)
Hence, Percentage = \(\frac{_{j}_}{_{j}_+_{{10-j}}_} \times 100\)
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore the Percentage of Apples = _{{j*10}}_ %

content.text: The percentage of apples, if ratio of apples to oranges is _{j}_: _{{10-j}}_.
